qas.question: What is an important Old English historical record?
What is an important Old English religious poem?
What type of literary work is Beowulf?
Who is the earliest English poet known by name?
What is the oldest surviving Old English literature?
What is the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle carved on?
What is considered the heart of world literature?
Who are usually well known among the Anglo-Saxons?

context: Some of the most important surviving works of Old English literature are <b5_0>Beowulf<b5_0/>, <a2_0>an epic poem<a2_0/>; <a0_0>the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle<a0_0/>, a record of early English history; the Franks Casket, an inscribed early <b6_0>whalebone<b6_0/> artefact; and <a1_0>Cædmon's Hymn<a1_0/>, a Christian religious poem. There are also a number of extant prose works, such as sermons and saints' lives, biblical translations, and translated Latin works of the early Church Fathers, legal documents, such as laws and wills, and practical works on grammar, medicine, and geography. Still, <b7_0>poetry<b7_0/> is considered the heart of Old English literature. Nearly all Anglo-Saxon <b8_0>authors<b8_0/> are anonymous, with a few exceptions, such as Bede and Cædmon. <a3_0>Cædmon<a3_0/>, the earliest English poet we know by name, served as a lay brother in the monastery at <a4_0>Whitby<a4_0/>.
